data.author: Jack London
data.en: Darn the wheel of the world! Why must it continually turn over? Where is the reverse gear?

data.author: Jack London
data.en: You can't wait for inspiration. You have to go after it with a club.

data.author: Jack London
data.en: San Francisco is gone. Nothing remains of it but memories.

data.author: Jack London
data.en: I write for no other purpose than to add to the beauty that now belongs to me. I write a book for no other reason than to add three or four hundred acres to my magnificent estate.

data.author: Jack London
data.en: I would rather be ashes than dust! I would rather be a superb meteor, every atom of me in magnificent glow, than a sleepy and permanent planet.

data.author: Jack London
data.en: There is an ecstasy that marks the summit of life, and beyond which life cannot rise. And such is the paradox of living, this ecstasy comes when one is most alive, and it comes as a complete forgetfulness that one is alive.

data.author: Jack London
data.en: Life is not a matter of holding good cards, but sometimes, playing a poor hand well.

data.author: Jack London
data.en: A bone to the dog is not charity. Charity is the bone shared with the dog, when you are just as hungry as the dog.

data.author: Jack London
data.en: I would rather be a superb meteor, every atom of me in magnificent glow, than a sleepy and permanent planet.

data.author: Jack London
data.en: The proper function of man is to live, not to exist. I shall not waste my days in trying to prolong them. I shall use my time.

data.author: Jack London
data.en: If cash comes with fame, come fame; if cash comes without fame, come cash.

data.author: Jack London
data.en: The scab is a traitor to his God, his mother, and his class.

data.author: Jack London
data.en: Life is so short. I would rather sing one song than interpret the thousand.

data.author: Jack London
data.en: One cannot violate the promptings of one's nature without having that nature recoil upon itself.

data.author: Jack London
data.en: Do you know the only value life has is what life puts on itself?
